name: places/ChIJd76XtuRYwokR_CIkjwWlRBw
formattedAddress: 133 E 54th St #202a, New York, NY 10022, USA
adrFormatAddress: 133 E 54th St #202a, New York, NY 10022, USA

originalText.text: Last year I tore my labrum playing basketball. After 9 weeks of no progress at a different facility, a friend of mine recommended Race to Recover. I worked with Dan who was awesome and super knowledgeable. He had me doing a complete new set of exercises from the other facility and I felt the difference within a couple of sessions. The one on one personalized care seemed to be the difference. Last Fall I was back to golf and this winter I’m back to heavy lifting in the gym, pain free.

originalText.text:
Have been running ultra marathons for almost 7 years.  Wouldn't have made it to the start line of a bunch of these without Dr Allison Lind.  She's incredible.  I have gone into sessions thinking I am done for a few weeks, but come out ready to run the next day.  Allison has a serious vendetta against tendonitis!

Allison also ironed out some running form issues I encountered when I switched to forefoot running.  We worked together on training routines, building strength whilst leaning in to workload, all without blowing myself up!  I live in Austin, TX now but am back in NY often enough.  Every time I'm back I see Allison (and try to poach her to TX!).  She's the best PT I have ever encountered.

originalText.text: Allison is the absolute best PT I've worked with. She helped me recover from a knee injury and then kept me in shape to run 2 pain-free marathons! I continue to see her for tune-ups and adjustments and would recommend her without hesitation.

text.text: Allison is the absolute best PT I've worked with. She helped me recover from a knee injury and then kept me in shape to run 2 pain-free marathons! I continue to see her for tune-ups and adjustments and would recommend her without hesitation.

originalText.text:
If I could give 6 stars I would.  I've been seeing Allison and Dan for nearly ten years, since long before Race to Recover.  They've helped me through two shoulder surgeries, one hip surgery, a half marathon... along with the constant battle of working a desk job and the general aches and pains of being an ex-athlete.

I had been to 15-20+ Physical therapists over the years before finding Allison and Dan - none since.  Really appreciate all the help and time they've dedicated to me over the years.  Very hands on therapists who really put work into each session.

I'd also thank them for the outside referrals/introductions.  I was able to get in to see top surgeons for the shoulder (Glashow) and the hip (Kelly), thanks to them.  Conversely, it says a lot to me that these surgeons like using Allison/Dan for their patients in recovery.  I've learned that surgeons are very picky about who they work with.

originalText.text:
I had a great experience with Race to Recover and would highly recommend their physical therapy practices to anyone in the New York City area.

I worked with Daniel Rofe on my herniated disc and had an extremely positive recovery process. It was nice working with a PT who asked a lot of questions about the background to my injury, before starting up a program. Not only was Daniel very knowledgeable about the injury itself, but he provided me with a personalized rehabilitation program that was tailored to my lifestyle, weekly activity, and specific needs based on the severity level of my injury. Daniel was also extremely helpful in providing recommendations and ways to avoid re-injuring myself moving forward.

The facilities are clean, modern, and I truly felt that I was able to receive the personalized care that was needed for a full recovery. You can tell that the PT staff at Race To Recover truly care about each individual patient!
